body.name: Magic Tree House Graphic Novel Starter Set: (A Graphic Novel Boxed Set) (Magic Tree House (R))
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author MARY POPE OSBORNE is the author of the New York Times #1 bestselling Magic Tree House series as well as coauthor of the Magic Tree House Fact Tracker series, along with her husband, Will, and her sister, Natalie Pope Boyce. For more information, visit the Magic Tree House website at MagicTreeHouse.com!JENNY LAIRD is an award-winning playwright. She collaborates with Will Osborne and Randy Courts on creating musical theater adaptations of the Magic Tree House® series for both national and international audiences. Their work also includes shows for young performers, available through Music Theatre International's Broadway Junior® Collection. Currently the team is working on a Magic Tree House® animated television series.KELLY and NICHOLE MATTHEWS are twin sisters, and a comic art team, living just north of the Emerald City under the watchful eyes of their cats and dog. They get to do their dream job every day drawing comics for a living (when they're not playing video games). They've worked for Boom Studios!, Archaia, the Jim Henson Company, Hiveworks and now Random House! Follow them on Instagram @kickingsh0es and Twitter @kickingshoes
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 17 hrs 33 mins
body.description: The #1 bestselling chapter book is now a graphic novel! Magic. Mystery. Time-travel. Get whisked back in time in the magic tree house with Jack and Annie in this giftable boxed set!There's a mysterious tree house in the woods and it's filled with books! Where did the tree house come from? Jack and Annie aren't sure. The real question is, where will it take them? Get whisked away with Jack and Annie in their first four adventures, now as graphic novels! This boxed set includes Dinosaurs Before Dark, The Knight at Dawn, Mummies in the Morning, and Pirates Past Noon.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: DINOSAURS BEFORE DARK GRAPHIC NOVEL THE KNIGHT AT DAWN GRAPHIC NOVEL MAGIC TREE HOUSE GRAPHIC NOVELS 1-2 BOXED SET The #1 bestselling chapter books are now available as graphic novels! After a mysterious tree house whisks Jack and Annie to the prehistoric past they must figure out how to get home or become a dinosaur's dinner! When the magic tree houses sends Jack and Annie back to the Middle Ages, they find that they aren't exactly welcome guests! Get whisked back in time in the magic tree house with Jack and Annie in this giftable boxed set!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Books are always good presents

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars That the books are entertaining for young children
reviews.reviewText: They were for my grandchildren and to my knowledge they are enjoying the books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great update to a favorite classic
reviews.reviewText: Kids (& adults) love Magic Tree House series. These graphic novels offer the same wonderful storylines along with vivid color comic style graphics & wording in new/early reader bites! Hesitant readers will find this style very inviting!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My daughter is obsessed
reviews.reviewText: Took a bit to get here but so so worth it, my Daughter loves it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brought the books to life!
reviews.reviewText: Normal, thin pages so I had to hold them for my son but we both enjoyed the stories in a comic book type form. It was fun to see the books I enjoyed as a kid come to life in pictures for my young child to view!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun but a bit advanced for a starting reader
reviews.reviewText: I bought this set of books for a beginning reader. I read them first and enjoyed them but thought the vocabulary might be a bit advanced for a second grader - and I was right. This child will grow in to these books I am sure but they are more appropriate for an 8 or 9 year old.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 4 yo really likes stories.
reviews.reviewText: I thought this might be a little early for my grandchild but he loves these stories for bedtime. We do very animated reading and sometimes hard for him to want to put away.
We have enjoyed reading the magic treehouse novels to our son. He really enjoyed all the extra pictures and just the new interpretation of his favourite stories.

reviews.reviewTitle: Limited Text per picture-lots of same pictures without Information
reviews.reviewText: My son is an avid reader of comics and we read just about everything. This comics looks like a beginner attempt to make a comics in terms of combining visual and text. There are lots of pictures showing the same thing but 1 second later and no additional information.Sorry, I am just comparing it to Dave Pilkey comics lets say. Each picture in Dave Pilkey comics is full of new interesting information/dialogue and progress.The book itself is very good but this comics based on the book is not ...yet...Maybe there would be an improved version soon...hopefully
Looks like I had the same issue as the others. Torn plastic and damaged box. Also purchased as a gift, disappointing.

This purchase was a gift. The books arrived on time, but there was some damage. The plastic shrink wrap was ripped and one corner was dented. Disappointed. Too late to return and get another before Christmas.
Books look ok but boxed set implies that books can be kept in their box - plastic is still on ( I assume repackaged so it looks like a used set
